title: Breaking News, Latest News and Current Affairs
text:
Outsourced murder: When hitmen hired other hitmen The hapless assassins kept passing on the contract — each time taking a cut of the cash — in the hope that someone lower down the chain would actually carry out the killing. But when the man with the lowest price got his marching orders, he decided instead to fake the murder — and enlisted the help of the intended victim.

Indians no longer need visas to visit Brazil Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Thursday the South American nation will drop its requirement that visiting Chinese and Indian tourists or businesspeople obtain visas. Bolsonaro has made it a policy to reduce visa requirements from a number of developed countries. But the announcement is the first he has made expanding that policy to the developing world.

9, 11 &13: Meet India's new climate warriors "What use is a future with dirty air and water," say India's young eco-warriors as they reveal why they feel “betrayed” by global leaders

Movie review: Housefull 4 It's fourth edition the Housefull franchise ensures that it takes its brand of over the top, mindless humour forward. Actually, it's more like the reverse since it rewinds back six hundred years to the 15th century.

We're moving on from MS Dhoni: MSK Prasad National selection committee led by MSK Prasad has communicated to BCCI president Sourav Ganguly, in the presence of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, that they were now looking beyond Dhoni while building the team for the next T20 and 50-over World Cups. Prasad said Pant will be backed over Dhoni even though the 22-year-old has suffered a slump in form recently.

'If Independents join BJP...': DS Hooda's vile dig BJP got 40 Assembly seats in the recently held Haryana Assembly elections, while Congress bagged 31 and Dushyant Chautala's JJP won 10 seats. Earlier in the wee hours of Friday, BJP working president JP Nadda had met the party's president Amit Shah at his residence. BJP's Haryana in-charge and party General Secretary Anil Jain and party's new Organising Secretary BL Santosh were also present in the meeting.

Assembly poll results: What worked & what didn't After big wins by BJP in Maharashtra and Haryana in the Lok Sabha elections few months ago and the widely perceived support for decisions on J&K, the party’s win was a given in assembly elections. However, voters sprang a surprise by denying BJP a majority in Haryana and restricting its mandate in Maharashtra. A look at what the verdict means..

Maruti won't launch EV for personal use next year Car market leader Maruti Suzuki India on Thursday said it will not commercially launch electric car, which it has been testing, for personal use next year, citing lack of infrastructure and government support.

‘Bunty and Babli’ caught at AIIMS; expose others A man and his girlfriend in ‘Bunty and Babli’ style, posted as computer operators at a patient registration wing, generated fake payment receipts and allegedly pocketed the money. A police complaint was lodged in this regard by the AIIMS, Bhopal. While Bunty got caught, Babli exposed the entire gang involved in the scam.

SC says telecos have to pay Centre Rs 92,000cr The SC allowed the Centre to recover over Rs 92,000 crore from telecom companies as licence fee and penalty. The court accepted the Centre’s contention that adjusted gross revenue (AGR) should include dividends, handset sales, rent and profit from the sale of scrap, apart from revenue from services.
